label: lem-boundary-heat-kernel
name: Heat-kernel death probability is Lipschitz with constant ≲ 1/σ
relations_established: Heat-kernel smoothed probability P_sigma(x) is Lipschitz continuous
natural_language_statement: Let $E=\mathcal{X}_{\mathrm{invalid}}\subset\mathcal X$ have finite perimeter and let $p_{\sigma^2}$ be the heat kernel at scale $\sigma$. Define $P_\sigma(x)=\int \chi_E(y)\,p_{\sigma^2}(x,\mathrm dy)$. Then $|P_\sigma(x)-P_\sigma(y)| \le C_d'\,\frac{\mathrm{Per}(E)}{\sigma}\, d_{\mathcal X}(x,y)$, with a constant $C_d'$ depending on dimension. Consequently $L_{\text{death}}\lesssim (\mathrm{Per}(\varphi(E))/\sigma)\,L_\varphi$ in the algorithmic metric.
full_statement_text: Let $E=\mathcal{X}_{\mathrm{invalid}}\subset\mathcal X$ have finite perimeter and let $p_{\sigma^2}$ be the heat kernel at scale $\sigma$.
